info.title: Open:Optimizer API
info.description: The Open:Optimizer API provides the ability to trigger portfolio optimizations using any of the optimizers available on FactSet, including the FactSet Portfolio Optimizer, Axioma Portfolio Optimizer (equity or fixed income), Barra Portfolio Manager, and Northfield Portfolio Optimizer. Endpoints are available to initiate optimizations and view results, as well as retrieve document names and related metadata. API access is available with a subscription to an optimizer application. This API is intended to complement, not replace, the optimizer applications on FactSet. All strategies must still be created using the corresponding GUI applications on FactSet Workstation.

post.description:
This endpoint runs FPO optimization specified in the POST body parameters.
            
Remarks:
            
*	Any settings in POST body will act as a one-time override over the settings saved in the strategy document.

get.summary: Get FPO optimization status by id
get.description:
This is the endpoint to check on the progress of a previously requested optimization.
If the optimization has finished computing, a 201 is returned and the result can be fetched using /fpo/{id} endpoint. 
Otherwise, the optimization is still running and the body of the response will contain a detailed status in JSON besides its pickup id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: from url, provided from the location header in the Create and Run FPO optimization endpoint

schema.description: from url, provided from the location header in the Create and Run FPO optimization endpoint

get.summary: Get FPO optimization result by id
get.description:
This is the endpoint to get optimization result.
If the optimization result is available, a 200 is returned. 
Otherwise, the optimization is still running and the body of the response will contain a detailed status in JSON besides its pickup id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: from url, provided from the location header in the Create and Run FPO optimization endpoint

schema.description: from url, provided from the location header in the Create and Run FPO optimization endpoint

delete.description: This is the endpoint to cancel a previously submitted optimization. Instead of doing a GET on the polling URL, cancel the request by doing a DELETE.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: from url, provided from the location header in the Run Optimization endpoint

schema.description: from url, provided from the location header in the Run Optimization endpoint

204.description: Expected response, optimization was canceled successfully.

404.description: There was no request for the optimization identifier provided, or the request was already canceled for the provided identifier.

get.summary: Returns a dictionary with the name-value pairs for all global variables.

post.summary: Returns a dictionary containing all strategies stored in a specified directory. Returns all strategies if no directory is given.

post.description: Fetch metadata for all FPO component types. Output is individually-filtered for each component type.
post.summary: Returns a dictionary with individually-filtered metadata for each component type.

id.description: Specify a shared or a local objective id.

enableHierarchy.description: Flag to enable or disable hierarchy in constraints

hierarchy.description: Map of constraint id to a hierarchy value >= 0

directory.description: The directories to recursively search. Defaults to returning all strategies

strategy.description: The ID of the document-level strategy from which to include the document-level FPO constraints.

documentLevelOnly.description: Only relevant if strategy is provided. Controls whether or not shared constraints are considered.

filters.description: Contains the criteria by which to filter the output.

strategy.description: The ID of the document-level strategy from which to include the document-level FPO constraints.

documentLevelOnly.description: Only relevant if strategy is provided. Controls whether or not shared constraints are considered.

filters.description: Contains the criteria by which to filter the output.

constraints.description: List of constraint type vs constraint id
List of constraint type vs constraint id

message.example:
Holdings data replaced for date 2024-01-21. 
5 symbols saved to Client:/folder1/fpo_archived_optimal1.ACCT.

optimalAccount.description: Location of the archived optimal account.

riskModelDate.description: Risk model date in YYYY-MM-DD format

OptimizationStatus.description: Schema for the status of an optimization process

detailedStatus.description: Detailed status message of the optimization

LimitMinute.description: Number of allowed requests per minute.

RemainingMinute.description: Remaining number of allowed requests per minute.

LimitSecond.description: Number of allowed requests per second.

RemainingSecond.description: Remaining number of allowed requests per second.

Limit.description: Number of allowed requests per second. This is same as X-RateLimit-Limit-second

Reset.description: Number of seconds remaining till rate limit resets.

OptimizationAccepted.description: The request to run an optimization has been accepted. The response includes a 202 Accepted status code, the ID of the new resource, and a Location header with the URL to check the status of the optimization.

Location.description: URL to poll for the resulting optimization

schema.description: URL to poll for the resulting optimization

OptimizationInProgress.description: Indicates optimization is in progress. The response body contains the detailed status.

Location.description: URL to poll for the resulting optimization

schema.description: URL to poll for the resulting optimization

OptimizationComplete.description: This indicates that the optimization is complete and the result is now available.

Location.description: URL to fetch the optimization result

schema.description: URL to fetch the optimization result

Risk Model.value: Axioma US Fundamental Equity Risk Model MH 4

StrategyResult.description: Expected response, contains the requested strategies.

GlobalVariableResult.description: Name-value pairs for each global variable.

ComponentResult.description: A JSON object with filtered metadata for all requested components

InvalidContentType.description: Missing/Invalid Content-Type header. Header needs to be set to application/json.

UserForbidden.description: User is forbidden with current credentials

OptimizationAlreadyReturned.description: Optimization result was already returned, provided id was not a requested optimization, or the optimization was cancelled

RateLimitExceeded.description: Rate limit exceeded. Check the X-RateLimit-* headers and resend the request.

ServerError.description: Server error. Log the X-DataDirect-Request-Key header to assist in troubleshooting.

ServiceUnavailable.description: Request timed out. Retry the request in sometime.
